title: How to Open or Close a Fish Hook Clasp

steps.title: Find a necklace with a clasp on it that looks like the above image, or similar.
steps.content: Find a necklace with a clasp on it that looks like the above image, or similar. Note that the necklace pictured above is of considerable age and the clasp is a bit tarnished. Fish hook clasps can look slightly different from this example.

steps.title: Hold the fish end in your non-dominant hand.
steps.content: Hold the fish end in your non-dominant hand. A flat side should face you, and your thumb and finger should hold both narrow sides.

steps.title: Hold the clasp and squeeze the narrow sides, where your fingers are, as shown above.
steps.content: Hold the clasp and squeeze the narrow sides, where your fingers are, as shown above. [1] X Research source As you're doing this, push the hook end back into the fish until you feel it loosen, and then pull it out.

steps.title: The clasp should now be halfway open, like this.
steps.content: The clasp should now be halfway open, like this. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Rotate the hook end around the small metal bar until it is free.
steps.content: Rotate the hook end around the small metal bar until it is free.

steps.title: Voila!
steps.content: Voila! The necklace is now open!

steps.title: With the necklace around your neck, turn it so that you can see the clasp.
steps.content: With the necklace around your neck, turn it so that you can see the clasp.

steps.title: Hold the clasp the way you did to open it, and reverse your steps.
steps.content: Hold the clasp the way you did to open it, and reverse your steps. [3] X Research source Feed the pointy end of the hook around the metal bar so that it looks like this:

steps.title: The fish and hook end should look as they do in the above image, so that the hook can slide straight back into the fish.
steps.content: The fish and hook end should look as they do in the above image, so that the hook can slide straight back into the fish.

steps.title: Slide the hook straight back into the fish.
steps.content: Slide the hook straight back into the fish. You might hear a small click, or feel the end of the hook lock in place. [4] X Research source

steps.title: The clasp is now closed, and you're ready for a fancy night out.
steps.content: The clasp is now closed, and you're ready for a fancy night out. A closed clasp should look like the picture in the introduction.
